005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.model;
007
008import java.util.function.Predicate;
009
010import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
011import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.Nullable;
012
013public interface INamedModelInstance extends IModelInstance, INamedInstance {
014
015  /**
016   * Tests if the provided instance represents complex data. The data is complex
017   * if one of the following is true:
018   * <ul>
019   * <li>The instance is a {@link IAssemblyInstance}.</li>
020   * <li>The instance is a {@link IFieldInstance} that has flags.</li>
021   * </ul>
022   *
023   * This method can be used as a {@link Predicate}.
024   *
025   * @param instance
026   *          the instance to test
027   * @return {@code true} if the data is complex, or {@code false} otherwise
028   */
029  static boolean complexObjectFilter(INamedModelInstance instance) {
030    boolean retval = true;
031    if (instance instanceof IFieldInstance) {
032      IFieldInstance field = (IFieldInstance) instance;
033      retval = !field.getDefinition().getFlagInstances().isEmpty();
034    }
035    return retval;
036  }
037
038  @Override
039  @NonNull
040  IModelDefinition getDefinition();
041
042  /**
043   * Indicates if a flag's value can be used as a property name in the containing
044   * object in JSON who's value will be the object containing the flag. In such
045   * cases, the flag will not appear in the object. This is only allowed if the
046   * flag is required, as determined by a {@code true} result from
047   * {@link IFlagInstance#isRequired()}. The {@link IFlagInstance} can be
048   * retrieved using {@link #getEffectiveJsonKey()}.
049   *
050   * @return {@code true} if the flag's value can be used as a property name, or
051   *         {@code false} otherwise
052   * @see #getEffectiveJsonKey()
053   */
054  // TODO: remove once moved to the instance side
055  default boolean hasJsonKey() {
056    return getEffectiveJsonKey() != null;
057  }
058
059  /**
060   * Get the JSON key flag instance for this model instance, if one is configured.
061   *
062   * @return the JSON key flag instance or {@code null} if a JSON key is
063   *         configured
064   */
065  @Nullable
066  IFlagInstance getEffectiveJsonKey();
067
068  /**
069   * Get the JSON key associated with this instance.
070   *
071   * @return the configured JSON key or {@code null} if no JSON key is configured
072   */
073  @Nullable
074  IFlagInstance getJsonKey();
075}
